name: Reggae / Ska / Dancehall
description: Umbrella for related forms of Jamaican Music which have grown beyond their regional roots to become global phenomena.

sub_genres.name: Dancehall
sub_genres.description: Developed from Reggae in the late 1970s, when Roots Reggae became more stripped-down, with an increased emphasis on pure rhythm.

sub_genres.name: Reggae
sub_genres.description: Developed in the 1960s; shuffling "bubble" and offbeat rhythms played on an organ, and staccato guitar and piano chords known as "skank."

sub_genres.name: Rocksteady
sub_genres.description: Jamaican popular music that blossomed briefly between 1966 and 1968 as an evolution of Ska, being slower, more relaxed, and soulful.

sub_genres.name: Ska
sub_genres.description: Originated in Jamaica in the late 1950s, characterized by a signature off-beat rhythm (referred to as the ‘skank’ rhythm), chop-style guitar work, busy bass lines and a use of horn sections.
